Package org.cesecore.keys.token

Interface CryptoTokenManagementSession

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    CryptoTokenManagementSessionLocal, CryptoTokenManagementSessionRemote
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CryptoTokenManagementSessionBean
    public interface CryptoTokenManagementSession
    CryptoToken management operations that require authorization and/or security events audit logging.
    Version:
    $Id: CryptoTokenManagementSession.java 30544 2018-11-19 15:12:01Z anatom $

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static String KEEP_AUTO_ACTIVATION_PIN
      Indicate that we would like to keep the current auto-activation PIN (if present) when save a CryptoToken.

        static final String KEEP_AUTO_ACTIVATION_PIN
        Indicate that we would like to keep the current auto-activation PIN (if present) when save a CryptoToken.

        void activate​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
              int cryptoTokenId,
              char[] authenticationCode)
       throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
              CryptoTokenOfflineException,
              CryptoTokenAuthenticationFailedException
        Requests activation of the referenced CryptoToken.
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - Auth Token
        cryptoTokenId - Crypto Token
        authenticationCode - Auth Code
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - If access denied
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - If offline
        CryptoTokenAuthenticationFailedException - if auth failed.

        cryptoTokenId - Crypto Token
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - If access denied

      • deleteCryptoToken

        void deleteCryptoToken​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                       int cryptoTokenId)
                throws AuthorizationDeniedException
        Remove CryptoToken with the specified ID. If this CryptoToken is backed by an HSM only the reference to the PKCS#11 slot will be removed not the actual key material. If the crypto token with the given id does not exists, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - Auth token
        cryptoTokenId - the id of the crypto token that should be removed
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - If access denied

      • isCryptoTokenStatusActive

        boolean isCryptoTokenStatusActive​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                                  int cryptoTokenId)
                           throws AuthorizationDeniedException
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - Auth token
        cryptoTokenId - Crypto token
        Returns:
        true if the CryptoToken with the specified ID has been activated.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - If access denied

      • isCryptoTokenPresent

        boolean isCryptoTokenPresent​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                             int cryptoTokenId)
                      throws AuthorizationDeniedException
        Checks if a crypto token is present.
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - Auth token
        cryptoTokenId - the ID of the crypto token
        Returns:
        true if it is exists and is present
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - If access denied

      • isCryptoTokenSlotUsed

        List<String> isCryptoTokenSlotUsed​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                                   String tokenName,
                                   String className,
                                   Properties properties)
                            throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                                   CryptoTokenNameInUseException,
                                   CryptoTokenOfflineException,
                                   CryptoTokenAuthenticationFailedException,
                                   NoSuchSlotException
        Checks if an intended Crypto Token (to be created) is already used. Primarily of use for PKCS#11 Crypto Tokens as there can be issues if creating multiple crypto tokens referencing the same PKCS#11 Slot.
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - an authentication token defining which crypto tokens can be compared, if this does not have full privileges the check is not complete
        tokenName - the name of the token we want to check
        className - the classname, org.cesecore.keys.token.PKCS11CryptoToken if this check should return anything but an empty list
        properties - crypto token properties, with the full PKCS#11 properties needed to create a PKCS#11 crypto token
        Returns:
        List or crypto token names which are using the same slot, or an empty list if there is none, an empty list is thus a sign to "go ahead"
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - If access denied
        CryptoTokenNameInUseException - If name already exists
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - If offline
        CryptoTokenAuthenticationFailedException - If auth fails
        NoSuchSlotException - If slot does not exist

      • createCryptoToken

        void createCryptoToken​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                       String tokenName,
                       Integer cryptoTokenId,
                       String className,
                       Properties properties,
                       byte[] data,
                       char[] authenticationCode)
                throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                       CryptoTokenNameInUseException,
                       CryptoTokenOfflineException,
                       CryptoTokenAuthenticationFailedException,
                       NoSuchSlotException
        Creates a crypto token with a known ID. Note that using an already existing ID will lead to an error at a later state.
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - an authentication token
        tokenName - the name of the token
        cryptoTokenId - a known and unused ID value.
        className - the class name of the crypto token
        properties - a properties file containing implementation specific values
        data - the keystore data. If null a new, empty keystore will be created
        authenticationCode - the authentication code to the slot. Will not activate the slot if offline
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - If access denied
        CryptoTokenNameInUseException - If name already exists
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - If offline
        CryptoTokenAuthenticationFailedException - If auth fails
        NoSuchSlotException - if no PKCS#11 slot as defined by the label in properties could be found

      • createCryptoToken

        int createCryptoToken​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                      String tokenName,
                      String className,
                      Properties properties,
                      byte[] data,
                      char[] authenticationCode)
               throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                      CryptoTokenOfflineException,
                      CryptoTokenAuthenticationFailedException,
                      CryptoTokenNameInUseException,
                      NoSuchSlotException
        Create a crypto token. This method will generate its own ID.
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - an authentication token
        tokenName - the name of the token
        className - the class name of the crypto token
        properties - a properties file containing implementation specific values
        data - the keystore data. If null a new, empty keystore will be created
        authenticationCode - authenticationCode the authentication code to the slot
        Returns:
        the ID of a newly persisted CryptoToken from the supplied parameters.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - If access denied
        CryptoTokenNameInUseException - If name already exists
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - If offline
        CryptoTokenAuthenticationFailedException - If auth fails
        NoSuchSlotException - if no PKCS#11 slot as defined by the label in properties could be found

      • saveCryptoToken

        void saveCryptoToken​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                     int cryptoTokenId,
                     String tokenName,
                     Properties properties,
                     char[] authenticationCode)
              throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                     CryptoTokenOfflineException,
                     CryptoTokenAuthenticationFailedException,
                     CryptoTokenNameInUseException,
                     NoSuchSlotException
        Update the CryptoToken with the specified ID. The authentication code can be omitted (null) if auto-activation is used.
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - Auth Token
        cryptoTokenId - Crypto token
        tokenName - Name
        properties - Properties
        authenticationCode - Auth code
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - If access denied
        CryptoTokenNameInUseException - If name already exists
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - If offline
        CryptoTokenAuthenticationFailedException - If auth fails
        NoSuchSlotException - if no such slot as defined in properties could be found

      • saveCryptoToken

        void saveCryptoToken​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                     int cryptoTokenId,
                     String newName,
                     String newPlaceholders)
              throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                     CryptoTokenNameInUseException
        Changes the name and key placeholders of a CryptoToken. Doesn't de-activate the crypto token, and can't be used to change any other properties (e.g. PKCS#11 slot etc.) or the authentication code.
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - Auth token
        cryptoTokenId - Id of the existing crypto token
        newName - New name of the crypto token.
        newPlaceholders - New key placeholders, in the same format as they are stored in the crypto token properties.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if access denied
        CryptoTokenNameInUseException - If the new name is already in use.

      • getCryptoTokenInfo

        CryptoTokenInfo getCryptoTokenInfo​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                                   int cryptoTokenId)
                            throws AuthorizationDeniedException
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - Auth token
        cryptoTokenId - Crypto token
        Returns:
        value object with non-sensitive information about the CryptoToken for UI use or similar, or null if token does not exist.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if access denied

      • getCryptoTokenInfos

        List<CryptoTokenInfo> getCryptoTokenInfos​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken)
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - Auth token
        Returns:
        List value objects with non-sensitive information about authorized CryptoToken for UI use or similar. Returns empty list if no tokens exist.

      • getIdFromName

        Integer getIdFromName​(String cryptoTokenName)
        Parameters:
        cryptoTokenName - Token name
        Returns:
        the cryptoTokenId from the more user friendly name. Return null of there is no such CryptoToken.

      • getKeyPairAliases

        List<String> getKeyPairAliases​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                               int cryptoTokenId)
                        throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                               CryptoTokenOfflineException
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - Auth token
        cryptoTokenId - Crypto token
        Returns:
        a List of all the key pair aliases present in the specified CryptoToken.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if access denied
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - If offline

      • createKeyPair

        void createKeyPair​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                   int cryptoTokenId,
                   String alias,
                   String keySpecification)
            throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                   CryptoTokenOfflineException,
                   InvalidKeyException,
                   InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        Generate a new key pair in the specified CryptoToken with the requested alias and key specification.
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - Auth token
        cryptoTokenId - Crypto token
        alias - Alias
        keySpecification - should be in the form "RSAnnnn", "DSAnnnn" or an known EC curve name.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - If access denied
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - if the CryptoToken is unavailable or inactive.
        InvalidKeyException - if key generation failed.
        InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - if the keySpecification is not available for this CryptoToken.

      • createKeyPairWithSameKeySpec

        void createKeyPairWithSameKeySpec​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                                  int cryptoTokenId,
                                  String currentSignKeyAlias,
                                  String nextSignKeyAlias)
                           throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                                  CryptoTokenOfflineException,
                                  InvalidKeyException,
                                  InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        Generate a new key pair in the specified CryptoToken with the requested alias using the key specification from another key in the same CryptoToken.
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - Auth token
        cryptoTokenId - Crypto token
        currentSignKeyAlias - Signing key
        nextSignKeyAlias - New signing key
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - If access denied
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - If offline
        InvalidKeyException - If key invalid
        InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - If params invalid
        See Also:
        createKeyPair(AuthenticationToken, int, String, String)

      • createKeyPairFromTemplate

        void createKeyPairFromTemplate​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                               int cryptoTokenId,
                               String alias,
                               String keySpecification)
                        throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                               CryptoTokenOfflineException,
                               InvalidKeyException,
                               InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        Generates a new key pair and deletes the placeholder.
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - Auth token
        cryptoTokenId - Crypto token
        alias - Alias
        keySpecification - Key spec
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - If access denied
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - If offline
        InvalidKeyException - If key invalid
        InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - If params invalid
        See Also:
        createKeyPair(AuthenticationToken, int, String, String)

                 int cryptoTokenId,
                 String alias)
          throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                 CryptoTokenOfflineException,
                 InvalidKeyException
        Parameters:

        Throws:

            throws AuthorizationDeniedException,

                   InvalidKeyException
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - Auth token
        cryptoTokenId - Crypto token
        alias - Alias
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - If access denied
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - If offline
        InvalidKeyException - if the CryptoToken was active, but the key pair removal failed.

                              InvalidKeyException

        Throws:

      • getKeyPairInfos

        List<KeyPairInfo> getKeyPairInfos​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                                  int cryptoTokenId)
                           throws CryptoTokenOfflineException,
                                  AuthorizationDeniedException
        Parameters:
        admin - Auth token
        cryptoTokenId - Crypo token
        Returns:
        list of information about all key pairs in the specified CryptoToken, but no references to the actual keys.
        Throws:
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - If offline
        AuthorizationDeniedException - If access denied

      • getKeyPairInfo

        KeyPairInfo getKeyPairInfo​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                           int cryptoTokenId,
                           String alias)
                    throws CryptoTokenOfflineException,
                           AuthorizationDeniedException
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - Auth token
        cryptoTokenId - Crypto token
        alias - Alias
        Returns:
        information about a key pair with the the specified alias in the CryptoToken, but no references to the actual keys. null if alias does not exist.
        Throws:
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - If offline
        AuthorizationDeniedException - If access denied

      • getPublicKey

        PublicKeyWrapper getPublicKey​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                              int cryptoTokenId,
                              String alias)
                       throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                              CryptoTokenOfflineException
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - Auth token
        cryptoTokenId - Crypto token
        alias - Alias
        Returns:
        the public key of the key pair with the the specified alias in the CryptoToken.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - If offline
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - If access denied

      • updatePin

        boolean updatePin​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                  Integer cryptoTokenId,
                  char[] currentAuthenticationCode,
                  char[] newAuthenticationCode,
                  boolean updateOnly)
           throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                  CryptoTokenAuthenticationFailedException,
                  CryptoTokenOfflineException
        Set the auto-activation PIN for a CryptoToken. For soft CryptoTokens this will change the pin of the underlying soft keystore as well. For PKCS#11 CryptoTokens this will only modify the auto-activation setting.
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - must be authorized to modify the CryptoToken
        cryptoTokenId - is the CryptoToken to operate on
        currentAuthenticationCode - is the pin that can currently be used to auto-activate (or manually active it if no auto-activation is used) this CryptoToken
        newAuthenticationCode - is the new pin to use or null to remove the current auto-activation pin
        updateOnly - if true, will only modify the auto-activation setting if already present. Soft CryptoTokens will still have a password change.
        Returns:
        true if the CryptoToken is auto-activated after call
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - If access denied
        CryptoTokenAuthenticationFailedException - If auth fails
        CryptoTokenOfflineException - If offline

      • isAliasUsedInCryptoToken

        boolean isAliasUsedInCryptoToken​(int cryptoTokenId,
                                 String alias)
        Returns true if the alias is in use by the crypto token
        Parameters:
        cryptoTokenId - id of the crypto token
        alias - the alias in question
        Returns:
        true if the alias is in use.
